    Prints the information contained in the group to stdout.

  • void UpdateBoundaries ()
    Runs through all positions in the group and update the left/right/top/bottom boundaries, this is usefull if you have used the fast methods which do not update boundary values.

  • bool RemovePositionFast (unsigned int Index)
    Same as RemovePosition, except that there is no range check for given index and the boundary is not updated and hence the function is a lot faster.

  • void AddPositionFast (const T &Pos)
    Same as AddPosition, except the boundary is not updated.

    Same as InsertPosition, except that there is no range check for given index and boundaries are not updated.

  • bool AddOffset (const T &Offset)
    Adds an offset to all points in group.

  • void Sort ()
    Sorts all positions contained in this class, sorting on first x and if equal on y value, position index 0 contains the "lowest" point.

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >

CPositionGroup2D, contains a group of positions, last updated 1/26/2002.

The template type must be a CPoint2D type or a CPoint2D derived class type. It can be convenient to store more information with each point, for that purpose simply derive a class from CPoint2D and add the extra data and functionality. Note: If you add extra data (member attributes) which needs to be saved and loaded, you must overwrite the two functions: 

          
                friend ostream& operator<<(ostream& s,const T& P2D);
                inline istream& operator<<(istream& s);
Easiest way to do it, is to copy the code from the base class and add some code for the new attributes. Note: A similar class name CPixelGroup is available, it is specialized for CPoint2D types and contains additional methods for working with images, it is build on top of a C implementation.

This class has two iterators: ConstIterator and Iterator. They work like the iterators in the C++ std-library, so if you are familiar with them, these are very easy to use. Here is an example: 

        CPositionGroup2D< CPoint2D<double> > Grp;
        Grp.AddPosition( CPoint2D<double>(1.1,1.1));
        Grp.AddPosition( CPoint2D<double>(2.2,2.2));
        Grp.AddPosition( CPoint2D<double>(3.3,3.3));

        CPoint2D<double> P(3.3,3.3);
        CPositionGroup2D< CPoint2D<double> >::ConstIterator It;
        for(It=Grp.Begin();It<Grp.End();It++)
        {
                if (P==*It)
                {
                        cout << *It << endl;
                        It--; // using postfix -- operator on iterator
                        cout << *It << endl;
                        --It; // using prefix -- operator on iterator
                        cout << *It << endl;
                        It++; // using postfix ++ operator on iterator
                        ++It; // using prefix ++ operator on iterator
                }
        }

For more details, see CPositionGroup2DIterator and CPositionGroup2DConstIterator classes.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CPoint2D , CPixelGroup , CPositionGroup2DConstIterator , CPositionGroup2DIterator
Version:
0.30, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class T>
ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::CPositionGroup2D (  const T &    InitBoundaryVal = T() ) 
 

constructor, initializes the boundary values to given value, defaults to (0,0).

Unlike the CPixelGroup, we cannot set the boundary values to maximum opposite values, since we do not know the range of type T.

Constructor allocating memory for positions to be contained in this class.

To make insertions fast, call this funcion with a value in InitialSize greater than the expected pixels in the group.

Parameters:

Definition at line 481 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
void ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::AdjustSizeOfPositions (    ) 
 

Removes unused memory allocated for positions in this class.

Because memory allocation is a time consuming operation it is a good idea by each ReAllocPositions (or the CPositionGroup2D(unsigned int InitialSize) constructor) call to allocate a big number of pixels and then at the end of the construction of a CPositionGroup2D calling this AdjustSizeOfPositions() method to deallocate unused memory.

Definition at line 159 of file positiongroup2d.h.

References ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::Iterator.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::CopyToImage (  COLORTYPE    BackGround,
CImage &    Dest,
bool    Absolute = false
) 
 

Copies a group to a new image.

Origo of the new image is set to (-Left.x,-Top.y) which is the groups top left boundary. Absolute positions can be plotted to a new image by setting the parameter Absolute to true, see Absolute parameter for more info. If positions are floating values, they are rounded to nearest integer. A black and white image with 1 b/p is produced, positions are plotted with opposite color as chosen background given in parameter BackGround

Parameters:
BackGround  The background color of new image, values are HIGHCOLOR (white) or LOWCOLOR (black)
Dest  Image to copy the group to. All previous information in Dest is destroyed.
Absolute  If true, group positions are plottet with their absolute values in a new image with dimensions (Right.x+1, Bottom.y+1). Origo is set to (0,0).
Returns :
False, if the group is empty, the Dest image is in that case left unchanged.

void ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::EmptyNoDeallocation (    )

This can optimize performance if the group is to be used again.

template<class T>
vector<T>& ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::GetDataReference (    )  [inline]
 

Returns a reference to the positions data contained in m_Positions, which is a standard vector class.

Can be used for fast access and manipulation of data. Note: Changing data this way means that the boundary information may need to be updated by a call to UpdateBoundaries().

Returns :
Reference to data contained in a vector class.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::InsertPosition (  T    Pos,
unsigned int    Index
) 
 

Inserts the position Pos at given Index, which must be less than the inserted pixels (returned by GetTotalPositions()).

The ordering of the positions is preserved. The boundary is updated if the new position is outside the old boundary.

Parameters:
Pos  Position to add to the PixelGroup.
Index  Index in the array of positions to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
See also:
InsertPositionFast

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::Load (  const char *    pPathAndFileName ) 
 

Load positions contained in file given by pPathAndFileName.

Format must comply with the format described in the Save() method.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/positions.txt", relative "positions.txt". Note: In order to use this method when this class holds types derived from CPoint2D, you may need to overwrite some streaming operators. See general description for this class for more info.
Returns :
False if load failed
See also:
Save

Also deletes the color values if available. Calls the kernel function k_CopyGroup().

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::PosInGroup (  const T &    Pos,
unsigned int &    Index
) 
 

Tests if given position is included in the group.

This method should be faster if the group is sorted in advance, haven't tested it though. Let me know if somebody have some results on that.

Parameters:
Pos  Position to test for.
Index  If the position "Pos" is found, the Index of the position is returned in this parameter. If not found, the parameter is unchanged.
Returns :
True if the position was found, false if not found.

Definition at line 759 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
void ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::PrintInfo (  bool    PrintPositions,
unsigned int    PosPrLine = 5,
unsigned int    Precision = 4
) 
 

Prints the information contained in the group to stdout.

Uses the operator friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &s, const T &P2D) for the type T of this class. That means you have to overload this method if your CPoint2D derived class contains extra data.

Parameters:
PrintPositions  If true, all pixel positions stored in the group are written to stdout.
PosPrLine  Number of positions to be written on each line (defaults to 5). Only used if PrintPositions is true.
Precision  Number of decimals to be shown, defaults to 4.

Definition at line 775 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
void ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::ReAllocPositions (  unsigned int    NewSize ) 
 

Reallocates memory for the positions contained in this class.

The new allocated memory is not initialised.

Parameters:
NewSize  The new number of positions to allocate memory for. Note: The NewSize may be less than the actual allocated memory! In that case the corresponding positions stored in the end of the actual memory are deleted.

Definition at line 734 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
unsigned int ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::RemoveDuplicates (    ) 
 

Removes duplicates of same position in this group.

The algorithm could probably be more efficient but it is still nice to have this functionality. To make it a bit efficient though, the order of the positions is not preserved, i.e. the same code as RemovePosition is used to remove positions, but no update of boundary is neccesary.

Returns :
Total number of duplicate positions removed.

Definition at line 705 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::RemovePosition (  unsigned int    Index ) 
 

Removes a position stored in the group at given index.

Done by moving the last position in the m_Positions array to the index which is to be removed. The boundary is also updated if the removed position causes changes in the boundary. Note: When running a loop to check for removal of positions, Index must be decremented when a position is removed as shown here: 


                        CPositionGroup2D<double> Grp;
                        for(int Index=0; Index<Grp.GetTotalPositions(); Index++)
                        {
                                if "test Grp[Index] with something" true
                                {
                                        // do something
                                        Index--; // decrement Index to avoid not testing all positions
                                }
                        }
Parameters:
Index  Index in the array of position to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
See also:
RemovePositionSlow

Definition at line 665 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::RemovePositionFast (  unsigned int    Index )  [inline]
 

Same as RemovePosition, except that there is no range check for given index and the boundary is not updated and hence the function is a lot faster.

For iterating in a loop see RemovePosition for details.

Returns :
True, always.
See also:
RemovePosition

Definition at line 473 of file positiongroup2d.h.

References ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::GetTotalPositions().

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::RemovePositionSlow (  unsigned int    Index ) 
 

Same as RemovePosition, but the ordering of the positions is preserved.

This method is slower than RemovePosition. For iterating in a loop see RemovePosition for details.

Parameters:
Index  Index in the array of position to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
See also:
RemovePosition

Definition at line 687 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::Save (  const char *    pPathAndFileName ) 
 

Saves positions contained in this group.

First a comment line is generated, then a token "CPositionGroup2D", then a token "TotalPositions:" followed by an integer which is the total positions contained in file. Format of positions is: 


                        pos=(x0,y0) dir= (i0,j0)
If direction is not available 'dir= (i0,j0)' is replaced with dir=N/A. Note: no space between 'dir=' and 'N/A', it is treated as one read token.
Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/positions.txt", relative "positions.txt". Note: In order to use this method when this class holds types derived from CPoint2D, you may need to overwrite some streaming operators. See general description for this class for more info.
Returns :
False if save failed
See also:
Load

Definition at line 903 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
void ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::SkipSpaceAndComments (  ifstream &    s )  [inline, protected]
 

used for loading.

Skips all whitespace, newline, tab characters and comment lines, i.e. rest of line from a '#' character.

Definition at line 535 of file positiongroup2d.h.

template<class T>
void ipl::CPositionGroup2D< T >::Sort (    ) 
 

Sorts all positions contained in this class, sorting on first x and if equal on y value, position index 0 contains the "lowest" point.

At the moment there is no way to ask if the points are sorted, the user must keep track of that. The functionality of this method may change a bit in future versions, it would be nice to specify if y should be the first sorting criteria.

Version:
0.1
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen
